div.p: Highly and well-learned, pious and wise, especially gracious, dear sir and good friend. After expressing my friendly greetings and offering all honors and goods, I hereby send you a cask of wine from Roll, where half is yours and the remaining half is for the rest of my lords, as you know, to distribute according to your will and pleasure. I hereby ask you to kindly accept this small token of appreciation and assure you of my goodwill towards you.
Wishing you and all yours a blessed upcoming year from God the Lord.
Dated Bern, 16th of December, 1571. Your entirely willing and good friend Johann Steiger.
To the highly and well-learned, pious and wise lord, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, leader of the church in Zürich, my gracious, dear lord.
Mr. Rudolf Walthard, Mr. Ludwig Lavater, Mr. Wolfgang Haller, Mr. Jörg Grebel.
